comment.body:
I'd have bet considerable money that the site is fake and has no actual content behind all its prompts, though the AdGuard team have surprisingly often found actual destination links on such link shortener sites.

(Althhough the blue arrows in two of the ads' upper right, means that something is odd, as that means the ads are supposed to be blocked by every major adblock list.)

comment.body:
I propose:
```
! https://www.fapnow.xxx/videos/12790/fun-with-latex-toys-meat-scarlet-chase/
||fapnow.xxx/bump^
||banhq.com^$third-party
fapnow.xxx##.block-video > .table
fapnow.xxx##center
fapnow.xxx###pause-ads
fapnow.xxx##.xpot-horizontal
fapnow.xxx##.fp-controls > a[href]
```

comment.body:
Although I was not able to replicate that specific problem, I encountered an even bigger and patently absurd problem on that site: 

When visiting from the European Economic Area, none of the images would load unless I added `history.com##+js(ra, block-on-gdpr-applicable)` as a custom entry in uBlock Origin.

issue.title: mail.ru

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/375

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)
